channel.title: Time syncronization
channel.description: I have kind of a silly question. Forgive me, I'm a newbie. :p So I'd like to ask if it's necessary to run NTS on both gate and workstation virtual machines? If yes, how can I run time syncronization through terminal? ( I prefer to run Gateway without KDE ).

item.title: Time syncronization
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
The non-technical answer is “yes”.

The technical answer is “no, and it’s not needed”. sdwdate keeps care of the system clock. Time savings plus minus one hour would be up the the operating system local time. Would not require manual interventions. Since time in Whonix is set to UTC that has no day time savings, no manual intervention needed.
